title: H2 storage - high rxn rate only at T above 200 C

content.description:
Li3N(s) + 2 H2(g) ⇄ LiNH2(s) + 2 LiH(s) 
ΔH° = -192 kJ/molrxn 
Because pure H2 is a hazardous substance, safer and more cost effective techniques to store it as a solid for shipping purposes have been developed. One such method is the reaction represented above, which occurs at 200°C.
content.question: Which of the following is the most likely reason that the reaction occurs at a significant rate only if the temperature of the reaction mixture is greater than 200°C?

choices.label: ΔS° for the reaction is negative.
The reaction has a high activation energy.

content.answer: The reaction has a high activation energy.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
